intro: Tuberaria vulgaris f. lanata, commonly known as the woolly rockrose, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cistaceae. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive, soft appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in Mediterranean climates, often in sunny, well-drained environments. Its flowers are usually pink or red, appearing in clusters and blooming in spring. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique texture and color.
